summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021, forwarding a January 2020 email from an FAA Law Enforcement Assistance Program (LEAP) official to an FBI Special Agent. The FAA official provides detailed aircraft registration and ownership information for helicopters and jets associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, including tail numbers N722JE (Air Ghislaine 2) and N331JE, owned by Hyperion Air LLC. The document reveals the complex ownership history of these aircraft and confirms the FBI's investigation into Maxwell's travel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of FBI investigation, private pilot
persons.context: The FBI email states she is the subject of a high-profile case, personally piloted a helicopter (N722JE/Air Ghislaine 2), and was a frequent passenger on jets associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Lawrence P. Visoski, Jr.
persons.context: Signed the current registration for helicopter N722JE on July 17, 2019, and for N331JE on November 19, 2019, on behalf of the registered owner Hyperion Air LLC.

persons.name: James D. Clark
persons.context: Signed as the seller for ASI Wings LLC when it sold helicopter N722JE to Hyperion Air LLC on June 13, 2019.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Signed the registration of aircraft N722JE for Freedom Air International, Inc. on August 2, 2010, and signed as the seller for Hyperion Air, Inc. when it sold helicopter N331JE to Hyperion Air LLC on August 12, 2013.

persons.name: William P. Merriam Jr
persons.context: Signed as the seller for Bovale Developments, Inc. when it sold helicopter N331JE (then registered as N901RL) on March 6, 2012.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Signed the registration of aircraft N722JE for Air Ghislaine, Inc. on December 29, 2008, when it was purchased from Sikorsky.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the FBI agent as someone Ghislaine Maxwell traveled with frequently; some of the aircraft are associated with him.

persons.name: Van Heurck
persons.context: The FAA official asks the FBI if this surname has any relevance to their case, suggesting this person was a potential pilot of one of the aircraft.

connections.description: The FBI email states Maxwell traveled with Epstein frequently, and some aircraft are associated with him.
Visoski signed aircraft registration documents for helicopters (N722JE, N331JE) owned by Hyperion Air LLC, which are linked to Maxwell.
Indyke signed registration documents for aircraft (N722JE, N331JE) linked to entities associated with Maxwell's travel.

events.title: FBI Request for Aircraft Information
events.description: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force sends an email to the FAA requesting information on aircraft believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: FAA Provides Aircraft Registration Details
events.description: An FAA official from the Law Enforcement Assistance Program (LEAP) responds to the FBI with detailed registration, ownership history, and LLC documents for aircraft associated with Maxwell and Epstein.

events.title: Maxwell's Pilot Certificate Issued
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's private pilot certificate (helicopter/rotorcraft) was issued.

events.title: N722JE Registration to Hyperion Air LLC
events.description: Helicopter N722JE (Air Ghislaine 2) registration issued to Hyperion Air LLC, signed by Lawrence P. Visoski, Jr.

events.title: Purchase of N722JE from Sikorsky
events.description: Aircraft that would become N722JE (serial 760750) was purchased from Sikorsky by Air Ghislaine, Inc.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell's use of private aircraft in December 2019, noting the case was 'high profile' and she traveled frequently with Jeffrey Epstein.

Helicopter N722JE, nicknamed 'Air Ghislaine 2', was owned by Hyperion Air LLC and had a complex ownership history involving entities like Air Ghislaine, Inc., Freedom Air International, Inc., and ASI Wings LLC.
Ghislaine Maxwell held a private pilot certificate for rotorcraft (helicopters) issued in 2007 and was confirmed to have personally piloted helicopter N722JE.

The FAA provided detailed registration histories for multiple aircraft, including helicopters N722JE, N331JE, N491GM (Air Ghislaine 1), and several private jets (N212JE, N1201E, N9091E, N9081E) associated with the case.

The FAA official encrypted the airman file for the subject (likely Maxwell) due to PII (Personally Identifiable Information) and medical privacy concerns, indicating sensitive personal data was part of the records.
